Chicken Meatloaf


Ingredients
cooking spray
1 pound ground chicken
1 small yellow onion, finely chopped
Â½ cup panko
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1/4 cup parsley
1/4 cup mayonnaise
3 cloves garlic cloves, minced
2 teaspoons fresh thyme leaves
2 teaspoons orcestershire sauce
1 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1/4 cup ketchup
2 teaspoons light brown sugar
2 teaspoons ijon mustard
1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar

Cooking Instructions

Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F
(175 degrees C). Lightly spray an 8-x 4-inch loaf pan with
cooking spray. Stir together chicken, onion, panko, Parmesan
cheese, parsley, mayonnaise, garlic, thyme, Worcestershire
sauce, salt, garlic powder, and black pepper in a large bowl
until just combined. Do not overmix. Transfer mixture to the
prepared loaf pan. Stir together ketchup, brown sugar,
mustard, and vinegar in a small bowl until combined. Evenly
spread ketchup mixture over the top of the meatloaf. Bake,
uncovered, in the preheated oven until an instant-read
thermometer inserted into thickest portion of meatloaf reads
165 degrees F (73 degrees C), 50 to 55 minutes. Remove loaf
from oven, and let rest 10 minutes before slicing and
serving.
Source 

https://www.allrecipes.com/chicken-meatloaf-recipe-8635675
